bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to the Society of Tropical Medicine, May 13, 1920

div1.p: Carter requests a copy of address given on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to the Society of Tropical Medicine, May 13, 1920
div1.opener:
Y. F
Paper
Asked for
May 13, 1920.
Drs. J. Birney Guthrie and Ri. T. Perkins,
Care Dr. Sidney K. Simon, Secretary,
American Society of Tropical Medicine,
Maison Blanche Bldg. New Orleans, La.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
I see in the program of the Society of Tropical Medicine of
April 26/20, which I was unable to attend, that you read a paper on
Blood Findings in Yellow Fever.

If, by any chance, you have a spare carbon of the same I would
be very glad if you would forward it to me as I am at work at pres-
ent on an epidemic in northern Peru, and as Noguchi and Kligler of
the Rockefeller are also we may be able to avail ourselves of your
findings.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General. Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
